parameters.name: ll
parameters.description: 44.3,37.2 required unless near is provided. Latitude and longitude of the user’s location.

parameters.name: near
parameters.description: Chicago, IL required unless ll is provided. A string naming a place in the world. If the near string is not geocodable, returns a failed_geocode error. Otherwise, searches within the bounds of the geocode and adds a geocode object to the response.

parameters.name: llAcc
parameters.description: 10000.0 Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters.

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: 0 Altitude of the user’s location, in meters.

parameters.name: altAcc
parameters.description: 10000.0 Accuracy of the user’s altitude, in meters.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: 250 Radius to search within, in meters. If radius is not specified, a suggested radius will be used based on the density of venues in the area. The maximum supported radius is currently 100,000 meters.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: food One of food , drinks , coffee , shops , arts , outdoors , sights , trending , nextVenues (venues frequently visited after a given venue), or topPicks (a mix of recommendations generated without a query from the user). Choosing one of these limits results to venues with the specified category or property.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: tacos A term to be searched against a venue’s tips, category, etc. The query parameter has no effect when a section is specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 10 Number of results to return, up to 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 20 Used to page through results, up to 50.

parameters.name: novelty
parameters.description: new Pass new or old to limit results to places the acting user hasn’t been or has been, respectively. Omitting this parameter returns a mixture of old and new venues.

parameters.name: friendVisits
parameters.description: visited Pass visited or notvisited to limit results to places the acting user’s friends have or haven’t been, respectively. Omitting this parameter returns a mixture of venues to which the user’s friends have or haven’t been.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: any Pass any to retrieve results for any time of day. Omitting this parameter returns results targeted to the current time of day.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: any Pass any to retrieve results for any day of the week. Omitting this parameter returns results targeted to the current day of the week.

parameters.name: venuePhotos
parameters.description: 1 Boolean flag to include a photo in the response for each venue, if one is available. Default is 0 (no photos). Photos are returned as part of the venue JSON object.

parameters.name: lastVenue
parameters.description: 4ef0e7cf7beb5932d5bdeb4e A venue ID to use in combination with the intent=nextVenues parameter, which returns venues users often visit after a given venue. If intent=nextVenues is specified but lastVenue is not, the user’s last check-in will be used if it is within 2 hours. If the user has not checked in within the last 2 hours, no results will be returned.

parameters.name: openNow
parameters.description: 1 Boolean flag to only include venues that are open now. This prefers official provider hours but falls back to popular check-in hours.

parameters.name: sortByDistance
parameters.description: 1 Boolean flag to sort the results by distance instead of relevance.

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: 2,3 Comma separated list of price points. Currently the valid range of price points are [1,2,3,4], 1 being the least expensive, 4 being the most expensive. For food venues, in the United States, 1 is < $10 an entree, 2 is $10-$20 an entree, 3 is $20-$30 an entree, 4 is > $30 an entree.

parameters.name: saved
parameters.description: 1 Boolean flag to only include venues that the user has saved on their To-Do list or to another list.

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: XXX123YYYY required The venue you want tips for.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: recent One of friends , recent , or popular .

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 100 Number of results to return, up to 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 100 Used to page through results.

parameters.name: USER_ID
parameters.description: HZXXY3Y Identity of the user to get lists for. Pass self to get lists of the acting user.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: edited can be created (lists created by this user), edited (other people’s lists this user has edited), followed (lists this user follows), friends (lists from this user’s friends), and suggested (lists relevant to the user’s current location).

parameters.name: ll
parameters.description: 40.7,-74 Location of the user, required in order to receive the suggested group.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 100 Number of results to return, up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 100 The number of results to skip. Used to page through results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 100 Number of managed venues to return. Defaults to 100, maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 500 Number of venues to skip over for paging. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: LIST_ID
parameters.description: IHR8THISVNU required id for a user-created list.

parameters.name: broadcast
parameters.description: twitter Where to broadcast this list. Send twitter if you want to send to twitter, facebook if you want to send to facebook, or twitter,facebook if you want to send to both.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Check out this cool list about tacos! A personal note to include with the share.

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: AVNU234 required The venue id for which an edit is being proposed.

parameters.name: problem
parameters.description: mislocated required One of mislocated , closed , duplicate , inappropriate , doesnt_exist , event_over .

parameters.name: venueId
parameters.description: BTEP567 ID of the duplicated venue (for problem duplicate ).

items.text: Lotsofsquirrelsinthepark!パーク内にはリスがたくさんいます！しかも思ったよりデカイです。

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: XXX123YYY required ID of the venue to retrieve

parameters.name: LIST_ID
parameters.description: 111XXXYY222 required ID for a user-created (e.g. /v2/lists/12381902N) or followed list or one of either USER_ID/tips (e.g. /v2/lists/32/tips)

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: 50 The number of results to skip. Used to page through results.

parameters.name: llBounds
parameters.description: 30.13,-98.16,30.40,-97.28 Restricts the returned results to the input bounding box.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: 4bf58dd8d48988d10e941 Restricts the returned results to venues matching the input category id.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: recent Sorts the list items. Possible values are recent and nearby . Recent sorts the list items by the date added to the list and nearby sorts the list items by the distance from the center of the provided llBounds .

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: A9ABCD required ID of venue to retrieve

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: 1 If 1 , like this checkin. If 0 unlike (un-do a previous like) it. Default value is 1 .

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: AVNU234 required The venue id to retrieve stats for.

parameters.name: startAt
parameters.description: 1284286794 The start of the time range to retrieve stats for (seconds since epoch). If omitted, all-time stats will be returned.

parameters.name: endAt
parameters.description: 1284286794 The end of the time range to retrieve stats for (seconds since epoch). If omitted, the current time is assumed.

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: XXX123YYYY required The venue you want photos for.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: checkin If not specified, public venue photos are returned ordered by relevance. Pass venue for public venue photos, ordered by recency. Pass checkin for venue photos from friends (including non-public photos from recent checkins), ordered by recency.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 100 Number of results to return, up to 200.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 100 Used to page through results.

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: 111XXYY222 required ID of venue to retrieve.

parameters.name: VENUE_ID
parameters.description: XXX123YYYY required The venue to like or unlike.

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: 1 If 1 , like this venue. If 0 unlike (un-do a previous like) it. Default value is 1 .

parameters.name: USER_ID
parameters.description: 111XXYY222 required User ID to retrieve tastes for.

parameters.name: venueId
parameters.description: 111XXYY222 required The venue where the user is checking in. Find venue IDs by searching or from historical APIs.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: What a view! A message about your check-in. The maximum length of this field is 140 characters.

parameters.name: shout
parameters.description: 111XXYY222 The event the user is checking in to.

parameters.name: mentions
parameters.description: 5,10,12a34b5e6 Mentions in your check-in. This parameter is a semicolon-delimited list of mentions. A single mention is of the form start,end,userid , where start is the index of the first character in the shout representing the mention, end is the index of the first character in the shout after the mention, and userid is the userid of the user being mentioned. If userid is prefixed with fbu- , this indicates a Facebook userid that is being mentioned. Character indices in shouts are 0-based.

parameters.name: broadcast
parameters.description: public,twitter Who to broadcast this check-in to. Accepts a comma-delimited list of values ( private , public , facebook , twitter , or followers ). If no valid value is found, the default is public .

parameters.name: ll
parameters.description: 44.3,37.2 Latitude and longitude of the user’s location. Only specify this field if you have a GPS or other device reported location for the user at the time of check-in.

parameters.name: llAcc
parameters.description: 1 Accuracy of the user’s latitude and longitude, in meters.

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: 0 Altitude of the user’s location, in meters.

parameters.name: altAcc
parameters.description: 1 Vertical accuracy of the user’s location, in meters.

parameters.name: ll
parameters.description: 44.3,37.2 Latitude and longitude of the user’s location, so response can include distance.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 20 Number of results to return, up to 100.

parameters.name: afterTimestamp
parameters.description: 123456 Seconds after which to look for checkins, e.g. for looking for new checkins since the last fetch. If more than limit results are new since then, this is ignored. Checkins created prior to this timestamp will still be returned if they have new comments or photos, making it easier to poll for all new activity.

parameters.name: USER_ID
parameters.description: 11XXYZ22 required ID of the user to get details for. Pass self to get details of the acting user.

parameters.name: ll
parameters.description: 44.3,37.2 required Latitude and longitude of the user’s location. (Required for query searches)

parameters.name: near
parameters.description: Chicago, IL required unless ll is provided. A string naming a place in the world. If the near string is not geocodable, returns a failed_geocode error. Otherwise, searches within the bounds of the geocode. Adds a geocode object to the response. (Required for query searches)

parameters.name: llAcc
parameters.description: 10000.0 Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

parameters.name: alt
parameters.description: 0 Altitude of the user’s location, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

parameters.name: altAcc
parameters.description: 10000.0 Accuracy of the user’s altitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: foursqu required A search term to be applied against titles. Must be at least 3 characters long.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 30 Number of results to return, up to 100.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: 800 Limit results to venues within this many meters of the specified location. Defaults to a city-wide area. The maximum supported radius is currently 80,000 meters.

parameters.name: sw
parameters.description: 44.3,37.2 With ne , limits results to the bounding quadrangle defined by the latitude and longitude given by sw as its south-west corner, and ne as its north-east corner. The bounding quadrangle is only supported for intent=browse searches. Not valid with ll or radius . Bounding quadrangles with an area up to approximately 10,000 square kilometers are supported.

parameters.name: addCategoryIds
parameters.description: 4bf58d1d4941735,4bf58dd8d4757494d21 Comma-separated list of new category IDs to be assigned to this venue. If you are adding a new category to a venue and you want to make it primary, you should just use primaryCategoryId .

parameters.name: removeCategoryIds
parameters.description: 123,abc Comma-separated list of new category IDs to be removed from this venue.

parameters.name: hours
parameters.description: 6,1700,2200;7,0900,1400,Brunch The hours for the venue, as a semi-colon separated list of open segments and named segments (e.g., brunch or happy hour). Open segments are formatted as day,start,end. Named segments additionally have a label, formatted as day,start,end,label. Days are formatted as integers with Monday = 1,…,Sunday = 7. Start and End are formatted as [+]HHMM format. Use 24 hour format (no colon), prefix with 0 for HH or MM less than 10. Use ‘+’ prefix, i.e., +0230 to represent 2:30 am past midnight into the following day.

parameters.name: TIP_ID
parameters.description: 111XXXYY222 required ID of tip to retrieve

parameters.name: PHOTO_ID
parameters.description: 111XXXYY222 The ID of the photo to retrieve additional information for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: 100 Number of results to return, up to 250.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 100 The number of results to skip. Used to page through results.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: newestfirst How to sort the returned checkins. Can be newestfirst or oldestfirst .

parameters.name: afterTimestamp
parameters.description: 1279044824 Retrieve the first results to follow these seconds since epoch. This should be useful for paging forward in time, or when polling for changes. To avoid missing results when polling, we recommend subtracting several seconds from the last poll time and then de-duplicating.

parameters.name: beforeTimestamp
parameters.description: 1279044824 Retrieve the first results prior to these seconds since epoch. Useful for paging backward in time.
